It is the reason you said. We don't support hot-auto-reboot agent to trigger register. Maybe in the next several versions.

If you have verified there is data in storage, read the first line of setup document, make sure your time and time zone of agent and OAP are as same as your browser. Or set browser UTC time(in UI) to match those.

> It is the reason you said. We don't support hot-auto-reboot agent to trigger register. Maybe in the next several versions.

Oh It is pity. I think it will be better if the issue is fixed
After. I will try to find some methods to fix it .Cause **it may be a nightmare if oap lose ES data, especially in product env.**
Cause i have deployed sw into dev env and I cant force everyone to reboot. And after losing es data. incredible amount of error data pouring in.
What's more another problem may be related to this.
lot of question marks may be due to lose of instance info before in ES.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24379174/60089912-0d7ff180-9774-11e9-9210-75a605720533.png)
In prod or other envs. we may consider that we can't force each one to reboot service. 
Or maybe I am thinking if there is **a mechanism in oap to re-register apps and trans old ids to new ones automatically, like 'logically reboot'**. Do you think it is  a good idea to solve this one?
We have plan, but still work in progress. 4 inventory indexes are only thing required safe. From our practices, we don't face that seriously. So PR works not that fast.

Do you really have over 300+ spans in a trace segment? If yes, you could open it in agent.config. The agent setup document shows the all options.

It’s weird I shouldn’t have that many spans. I see that the dashboard shows the count of services, database etc but graphs don’t show any information. 

Will increase the span limit to see if I spot anything.

@gamefundas  i am new for apache skywalking. I have downloaded skywalking 6.1.0 and setup on linux machine. Same linux machine i used to setup backend and UI. On same VM my java application docker conatiner is running in which i have configured the skywalk agent. Once i open the UI in that not able to see any service or application or anything. Please suggest me or let me know how to configure agent.
Please search error before submit a new one. We have fixed this in master several weeks ago.

> It’s weird I shouldn’t have that many spans. I see that the dashboard shows the count of services, database etc but graphs don’t show any information.

That is my guess, there is one or several incompatible plugins you are using, so trace would be finished and reported. I would suggest you to use one plugin a time, from Tomcat or SpringMVC, to see what happens.
And in SkyWalking, plugin remote debug skill is important. Plugins are tested many times, but with a huge number of versions, it still bases on your use scenarios.
@jatin85 If you are new, want to discuss 101, slack is a better place. For container, most users forget to choose UTC0(container default tz) in UI.
Thanks @wu-sheng . Please share slack channel.

1. After thinking for a while, I decided to replace `COMMIT_HASH` with `BUILD_ID` as part the identifier of the container to cope with rebuilding, suffixed by an index (`-n`) to cope with parallel running. Reason is that if a job is interrupted, we have to clean up all the containers started by that job.

2. Bug of verifications are fixed and tests are added, though I'm not very satisfied with the design now, any better design for verifications are welcome to discuss.

3. Will try to add another sample including this later

4. Verifications of services, topology, traces are added, metrics are in progress
